attributes.action: Minimum of 10 years for causing death by careless or dangerous driving
attributes.background: Too many people are being killed by drivers being drunk, on drugs or using mobile phones will driving.

attributes.action: Make health workers exempt from parking tickets when delivering a public service
attributes.background: Allow domiciliary carers, emergency services, District nurses and doctors to park on single or double yellow lines when carrying out a health service for the public in their own homes.
attributes.additional_details: Care workers,District nurse,emergency services&doctors find it difficult to park when delivering a care service.if they display a notice,when parked on yellow lines, explaining they're there for a reason,they should be exempt from parking tickets within a certain time frame.The health services are under massive constraints&strains&are extremely limited to time,Parking issues need to be addressed. Councils pay for care to be delivered but penalise those very people when parking is unavailable.

attributes.action: Help me to deport my little brother from a Singaporean prison back to the UK
attributes.background: In the November of 2016 19 year old Lorenzo Dentamaro, was arrested in Singapore on accusations of fraud. He spent 6 months on bail battling the case only to be made an example of and harshly served with 3 years inprisomment. He is currently in 16 man cell, suffering in 30 plus temperatures.
attributes.additional_details: My family is suffering, I have grandparents that are very old and may never have the opportunity to see him again. We have to travel 13 hours to see him for only 20 minutes and I just want to bring him back home so he can complete his sentence in the UK. My mother is depressed, our lives have been impacted serverely and I am constantly living on breaking point. I just want to bring him home.

attributes.action: Reverse UK Sport decision not to fund badminton
attributes.background: UK Sport withdrew funding from Badminton for the next Olympics and restored approximately 10% of this funding back. In contrast around 30 million of funding was given to athletes for winter sports. We petition the government to restore funding to Badminton for the next Olympics.
attributes.additional_details: Badminton is the most popular indoor sports in the UK and is one of the few sports that can be played all year round in the UK. Winter sports is not a common sports in UK as the weather conditions and facilities are not conducive to it. It is limited in its availability to masses. If proper funding is available, badminton is much more likely to yield Olympics medals and also motivate the younger generation to participate in a sport that is readily available to them.

attributes.action: Mandyâ€™s Law:  â€œCarers' Charter", Supporting Carers mainly in the Home
attributes.background: Support carers and their families caring at home. More financial and physical support to help relieve the enormous stress and strains put on their lives. I have been a carer three times during a forty year period and personally seen and endured this most destructive way of life caring can often be.
attributes.additional_details:
Carers Allowance increase to Â£95pw and free from income assessment
Carers in receipt of a State Pension must also qualify for Carers Allowance .
Mortgage Interest allowance increase up to Â£300000
Up to six hours free home care to give Carers time to shop and rest
Return Community Care back into the hands of the NHS
Free prescriptions for all full time Home Carers
Free respite care to provide time for Carers education and time out
Full grants for ex child carers to move on to College / University

attributes.action: New drivers to have black box with continuous speeding reported to the police
attributes.background: Most new drivers today think they are invincible on the roads. All black boxes do at the moment is record excessive speeding to the car insurance companies that use them. Why are these behaviours not reported to the police and why are drivers not punished for this behaviour?
attributes.additional_details: It should be mandatory that all new drivers have a black box for their first year of driving, with all continuous excessive speeding data sent to the police. Police should deal with this behaviour the same as if they caught the driver themselves, via a driving awareness course or points. Black boxes shouldnâ€™t be limited to just cars either, they should be on all road legal transportation. This could not only potentially save lives, but save money on insurance in the long run too.

attributes.action: Make it a crime to remove dairy calves' teats without anaesthetic & pain relief
attributes.background: Many dairy calves have extra or "supernumerary" teats removed with a scalpel or scissors. It is only "recommended" to provide anaesthetic. Not legally required to provide anaesthetic and pain relief medication afterwards
attributes.additional_details:
For more information see the following links
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235188/Welfare-sheet-Dairy-cows.pdf
http://adlib.everysite.co.uk/adlib/defra/content.aspx?id=000IL3890W.182WIKRB434ZN7
http://www.gov.scot/Publications/2009/06/18114130/10

attributes.action: Make councils set up payment plans for parking tickets instead of total payment
attributes.background: Make it so councils have to let people pay fines in installmemts for people who canâ€™t afford to pay in a lump sum for parking tickets. Instead of passing it to private bailiff firms who add more costs and wonâ€™t accept an affordable payment plan until their fees have been added on.
attributes.additional_details: I had a parking ticket which I couldnâ€™t pay in a lump sum.  The council wouldnâ€™t let me pay in installmemts so it got passed to the bailiffs and more charges put on. Then they came and clamped my van I use for self employed work and removed it after they were told it was for my business and valued under Â£1350. I have a 7 year old child who I can not get to school anymore and I have no income now and have complained and appealed but still no van. I made payments but they wanted Â£80 a month.

attributes.action: Set the living wage age bracket to 21 and over
attributes.background: At the age of 21 you are regarding as an adult. You pay the same rates as a person 25+ and receive no tax reduction, discount on food/petrol/electricity/mortgage bills, etc. Why then, does the living wage only apply to the 25 and overs? Help the younger home owners and families live and provide.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaking from a personal perspective, my partner and I have 2 cars on finance, own a house and have started a family. Why should we not be entitled to the living wage?

At the age of 16 you are permitted to have a child and be expected to provide. At 17 you can drive and own a car, which needs upkeep. At the age of 18 you can buy a home which come with bills and expenses.

To discriminate on age is unacceptable. The government does not know an individuals curcumstance.

attributes.action: Justice for Zainab! Put pressure on the Pakistani government to act on rape.
attributes.background: Zainab is a 7 year old girl who was abducted when on her way to her Islamic lessons. She was raped and murdered and left in a pile of rubbish. Her parents were away on Ummrah when this had happened. Action needs to be taken! Pressure needs to be put on the Pakistani government to take rape seriously
attributes.additional_details: Put pressure on the government to introduce sexual abuse awareness to children! What is appropriate and what is not.

attributes.action: Make Paper Carrier Bags & Packaging compulsory for shops and manufacturers
attributes.background: The Government introduced the 5p charge on carrier bags in shops they are now planning to implement it across all. BUT what they should be doing is stopping plastic being used- Paper Carrier Bags and packaging is far better for us and can be recycled easily this would be Enviromentally safer.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic carrier bags get into the water supply and sea causing harm to wild life and also in long run the food chain - Paper can be made to be biodegradable so if dumped would not cause harm to wild life and so would not harm us - let the UK ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§ be a world leader in starting to bring back the classic Paper Carrier Bags for shops and then front leader in Paper or biodegradable card for packaging for manufacturers

attributes.action: Pets in pet shops need to be in bigger and better tanks/cages. Itâ€™s just cruel.
attributes.background: Everyday you see rodents, such as hamsters, cavies, rabbits just stuck in tiny glass cages with little to no movement...and it is awful. Iâ€™d really like the legal cage requirements to be doubled as it breaks my heart seeing them in that condition

attributes.action: Enable ILR for Tier 2 Established Staff Visa which was issued before April 2011
attributes.background: As per the current rules, Tier 2 ICT Visa holders which was issued before April 2010 are eligible for ILR. In April 2010, rules have been changed and Tier 2 ICT Visa was given with the name as Established-Staff until April 2011. This Visa can be extended any number of times but not eligible for ILR.
attributes.additional_details: The rules have been changed again in 2011 to restructure the Tier 2 ICT Visas. Under these rules, Tier 2 ICT Visa holders who obtain Visa after April 2011 are eligible for settlement. This petition is for enabling ILR after completion of 5 years for Established-staff category Visa holders. As this Visa holders stayed in the country for more than 6 years, but not eligible for ILR under 5 year route. The number Visas issued between April 2010 and 2011 are very less and few people are remaining in the country right now. So, please enable ILR for Established staff category Visa holders under 5 year rule.

attributes.action: - To send aid to the people of Yemen and raise awareness
attributes.background: There is a war, a war we have all forgotten about. The Yemeni civil war is crushing its people and causing all kinds of ill fate, from starvation, illnesses and death. This forgotten war cannot stay in the dark.

attributes.action: Add red hair colour to the protected characteristics of the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop cruel comments with insinuations that being a red head is unfortunate ugly and embarrassing.That a person deserves to be bullied because there a red head.
attributes.additional_details: Taunting red heads seems to be the last socially accepted freebie in society, yet it's impact can be as devastating to the receiver as any person covered in the discrimination act. Abuse ranges from name calling which leads to low self esteem and depression. Most disturbing suicide. Serious assaults have occurred just for being a red head. A red head can't change the colour of hair. Like a person can't change their skin colour, sexual orientation or disability.  It can't continue. It's not "OK".

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid to Â£2B and use the balance for UK Defence and Public Services.
attributes.background: The Foreign Aid budget of  0.7% of GDP is an arbitrary target which sees the UK actually borrow money to then give it away to foreign countries. At a time of such worldwide insecurity, this money would be much better spent on the UK's Armed Forces and on helping the NHS & other Public Services.

attributes.action: Make banks reduce affordability criteria for mortgages for first time buyers.
attributes.background:
Affordability criteria with banks is currently around 3-4 times salary with adjustments for expenses. 

Even with Help-to-Buy, a person on the current living wage would have a Â£30,000 deficit on the 75% mortgage they would need to afford a Â£150,000 property.
attributes.additional_details:
The current affordability criteria makes it impossible for a single person to afford their own home. 

Banks are still making large profits, yet they seem unwilling to increase their risk in order help hardworking people afford their own place to live. 

Using mortgage calculators for a required amount, buyers see amounts which they feel they could afford, yet the affordability criteria excludes them from applying. 

This petition proposes banks meet the 75% regardless of salary for Help-to-Buy.

attributes.action: Improve safety and quality of our road network and reduce congestion
attributes.background: 1.Starting in driving schools by ensuring there is more attention on teaching safe driving on motorways and dual carriage ways. We think that driving on these types of roads requires techniques that are not well emphasised by current training methods.
attributes.additional_details:
Improvement could be achieved if new drivers would be taught of correct speed selection, acceleration and keeping left when not overtaking. 
2.Improving existing roads by installing more signs to remind drivers of simple rules such as:
-Keep left when not overtaking (middle lane hogging)
-Keep your distance

attributes.action: Only allow fireworks on Firework night and New Years Eve due to pets rights.
attributes.background: I believe it is wrong that fireworks are released for days before and days after both Fireworks night and New Years Eve. This can scare pets and cause them to be unable to move from a position or relieve themselves outside. This is against their rights under the five freedoms, so should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: This can also cause animals to run away from owners, or bolt when on walks, and so can leave owners devastated, and can lead to deaths and injuries to these animals. This can cause both emotional, physical and financial damage to the owners and public, along with emotional and physical damage to pets.

attributes.action: Ban Fines for Parking Ticket Mistakes
attributes.background:
Honest people who have purchased valid parking tickets are being fined because of genuine mistakes - such as accidentally mistyping number plates in car parks that use number plate recognition. 

The British Parking Association know this - but their appeal system but offers no help.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has nothing to do with fines for overstaying or not purchasing a ticket - this is for genuine mistakes.

Typically people have a single character wrong on their ticket - and still appeals side with the car park owners.

To anyone else - it would be clear that the driver had made a genuine mistake, and paid the correct amount for the time allocated.

This money making on genuine mistakes should be stopped.

A typing error should not cost someone Â£60+

attributes.action: To make it easier for grandparents to get parental Responsibility
attributes.background: Fathers, same sex parents and step parents can get PR by downloading the form and taking it to the local court to be witnessed and signed and thatâ€™s it they have PR.
attributes.additional_details: Grandparents have to get mediation and then apply to the family court for permission to apply for a residence order or special guardianship order which can all take months. How can this be right over 200,000 grandparents are bringing up one of more of their grandchildren. I realise children have to be protected and made safe but making it this hard for grandparents to get PR is not doing this.

attributes.action: Make promoting Paedophilia a criminal offence
attributes.background:
It's time for the UK Parliament to better protect and deliver justice for our children by proving to the British People that they believe Paedophilia to be abhorrent. 
Paedophilia has been promoted by speakers at a conference held at the University of Cambridge in 2013.

attributes.action: Government to take the European Commission to the ECJ for misconstruing Art 50.
attributes.background: In Article 50 of the Treaty of Lisbon there is no mention of monetary reparation for leaving, continual jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice, continual rights of European citizens in the departing territory, or soft annexation of its sovereign territory
attributes.additional_details: Mr Juncker and Mr Barnier seem to want to penalise the UK because of Brexit. But the Treaty of Lisbon makes no particular obligations on leaving countries. If the Treaty envisaged continual supremacy of the ECJ over national courts after departure, or continual freedom of movement for European citizens in the departing country after departure it should have been a treaty provision rather than implied by latter day negotiators.

attributes.action: Investigate the links between MPs and foreign intelligence services
attributes.background: In our age of democracy it is important that all our representatives in Parliament do not act in a way that can be seen to be against parliamentary and democratic standards.

attributes.action: Govt take action to protect UK citizens in Kerala regarding elephant parades
attributes.background: Every year UK citizens visit Kerala to watch religious ceremonies exploiting captive elephants. The elephants are subjected to the most horrific cruelties in order to control them. The ceremonies always take place during musth season so the elephants are regularly running amock and harming people.
attributes.additional_details: It's important the Govt informs UK citizens of high risk of danger to human lives.

attributes.action: Make Greyhound racing illegal in the U.K .
attributes.background: Greyhound racing must be banned in the U.K. This "sport" remains legal in 8 countries and one of them is the U.K. The sport is inhumane and over 10,000 greyhounds vanish/die every year. This is why we believe it has to stop . #YouBetTheyDie #NoGreyhoundRacing
attributes.additional_details: Greyhound racing is a popular industry here in the U.K. Beautiful dogs race at ground-scaring speeds; the thrill making quick quid off a brutal bet - this all entices many dog-racing enthusiasts, betters and gamblers alike. However, the reality is greyhound-racing is cruel and disgusting. Over 10,000 greyhounds a year are tossed aside due to being "useless". Around 8,000 of these are retired. These poor dogs are then left to starve, abandoned, murdered, sold for dissection purposes and worse.

attributes.action: Lower Prescription charges
attributes.background: People already pay taxes which goes to medicine which technically means that everyone is paying twice. This means we pay to make or buy them from other places, then we pay again to get them from a pharmacy which is ridiculous.
attributes.additional_details: Some people get prescription that doesnâ€™t work, but they still have to pay for a new prescription. This is not fair as you cannot get a refund and the prescription did not do what it was made to do.

attributes.action: Councils should be able to nominate people to a different council for downsizing
attributes.background: The Government should extend the Right to Move to tenants who want to downsize. There are so many council tenants under occupying properties that bigger families desperately need.
attributes.additional_details: All councils & housing associations should be giving tenants an incentive to move out of these bigger properties, like allowing a tenant to be nominated to a borough of the tenants choice. Local authorities shouldnâ€™t be allowed to apply a local connection test if it could disadvantage tenants who need or want to move across local authority boundaries to downsize.

attributes.action: Bring forward the 2020 London Mayoral Elections to 2019.
attributes.background: The 2020 London mayoral elections should be brought forward from 2020 to 2019 in order to de-conflict with a possible general election also due 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The current London assembly is running with the idea that the election should be delayed until 2021 because of the chance of a general election in the same year (2020). This will give the current mayor an extra 12 months in power without being re-elected.

Londoners should be given the opportunity to select a new mayor sooner rather than later. The people of London must be given the chance to rid themselves of the massive increase in crime associated with the current mayor.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists filtering on blind side and apply 1.5m rule in all cases
attributes.background: Cyclist's are putting themselves in danger passing through tiny gaps on blind side where they are not seen by motorists and should abide by the 1.5m passing rule to avoid causing dangerous road conditions and damage to vehicles where cyclists aren't insured

attributes.action: Stop all serving politicians from being included in any Honours lists
attributes.background: Time and time again who ever is in government are seen to be rewarding loyal members of their party even if they aren't doing a good job. Being Knighted for sitting on a committee or being a loyal party member isn't good enough and is making a joke of the whole system.

attributes.action: Ban the testing of household cleaning product ingredients on animals.
attributes.background: There is no law in the UK that bans the testing of cleaning products on animals. This is a cruel practice with no practical use whatsoever. I urge you to please sign this petition if you , like me love animals and do not want to see them suffer.

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls sooner than December 2018.
attributes.background: The Severn bridge tolls are due to be scrapped in December 2018, with a reduction in January 2018. The bridge has paid for itself several times over but the UK government refuse to abolish the tolls sooner, this is having a detrimental effect on the welsh economy, welsh business and commuters.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal,not civil, offence to take part in an unauthorised encampment
attributes.background: Many UK citizens are regularly subjected to anti-social behaviour by people who make camp in their neighbourhood whilst on their travels. Invariably when they move on they leave a considerable amount of mess and damage behind which costs the land owners a significant amount of money to address.
attributes.additional_details: On more than one occasion our local school have been required to pay many thousands of pounds to clean up the children's playing field after travellers had left. There was national outrage recently when travellers left 600 ton of rubbish in a field in Uxbridge. They were not even issued with a ticket for littering! Anyone taking part in an unauthorised encampment must be held legally responsible for leaving the site in the same state as they found it and also prosecuted in the courts.

attributes.action: Provide victims of the most severe sexual crimes anonymity throughout trial.
attributes.background: Currently victims of crimes under the Sexual Offences (Amendment) Act 1992 are given lifetime anonymity from the media. Despite attempts to fully provide protection during trial details of the victims name are made available to the accused; even in cases of serious sexual assault by a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls for other means of identifying victims such as pseudonym, case number or photo to be considered.
 
Sexual assaults are crimes of power and control, a name is a key part of personal identity so giving the accused the victimâ€™s name adds to the assault. Much of what you do or are is linked to your name, having it makes it easy to identify, locate or contact someone.
 
Using a victimâ€™s name within courts would seem to contravene Article 8 of the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: Establish a Public Service Production Company thats funded by the British public
attributes.background: Our film industry is currently a subsidiary of the US film industry. US Film Companies are incentivised by the Government to produce their films in the UK through tax rebates and breaks Instead of financially supporting the US industry the Government needs to financially support it's own
attributes.additional_details:
The petitions asks for the establishment of a publicly owned and funded film production company that produces films which serve a public interest. 

References http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-28213379 http://ask.ofcom.org.uk/help/television/what_is_psb http://www.newstatesman.com/culture/2015/03/we-dont-have-british-film-industry-business-film-takes-us-behind-movie-scenes

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and put the money into road repairs and improvement.
attributes.background:
Pot holes are causing serious damage to vehicles and injury to road users such cyclists and motorcyclists. All are at serious risk.

So cancel HS2 with its budget of Â£15 billion and put the money to work right away on the roads. That will benefit more people than a high speed rail link.

attributes.action: Allow supply teachers to pay into the 'Teachers' Pension'.
attributes.background: Supply teachers cannot pay into the Teachers' Pension. If you are contracted for 2 hours a week you can opt-in, but as a supply teacher working 5 days a week you can't. Why? Because supply agencies don't employ us, so can't pay the employer's contribution. The ethics of agencies are another debate.
attributes.additional_details: Supply teachers used to be employed by LEAs. They were paid to scale, had pay progression and a pension. Successive governments have turned a blind eye to agencies taking this role where supply teachers are not paid to scale, have no pay progression and have no pension. A supply teacher will earn Â£16000 a year if they work every school day (the agencies having got Â£29,250 for that teacher). Some things we have to accept: the government signing our pension away, we shouldn't have to.

attributes.action: Stop Government bTB tests being a death sentence on healthy animals.
attributes.background: Alpaca owners want the Government to work with them to eradicate bovine tuberculosis(btb). Testing rules are draconian and need to be reviewed. Please support a testing regime that does not condemn a healthy alpaca to death by always allowing a retest where no substantial evidence for disease exits.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment less than 7% of alpacas have been tested and the industry wants that to be at least 80%. 

bTB test results are not being shared by APHA or collated and thus no opportunity exists to improve the current situation. Animals are unnecessarily culled before the data is captured. The situation will never improve unless we all work together to learn more about these unique animals for the benefit of all livestock keepers in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ask for someoneâ€™s previous salary.
attributes.background:
The salary negotiation process, and specifically the gender salary gap is directly affected by a company knowing a personâ€™s previous salary. 

The salary band for the role should be defined for the role, and based on the responsibility and scope.

This shouldnâ€™t be based on the previous salary.
attributes.additional_details: Previous salary should be treated like date of birth or age, gender, disability or trade union membership.

attributes.action: Change the law to make the sex offenders register public
attributes.background: Every few months we hear of another sex offender whoâ€™s been living in our area beside our kids and schools, our children are not safe to walk to school or play with friends because they keep them protected and not the people at real risk

attributes.action: Make all ESA & PIP assessment centres fully accessible.
attributes.background: Too many people are arriving for a DWP disability assessment to discover they cannot get into the building due to steps, stairs or staff only lifts. Many of these people are being told they should have informed the assessment providers they required wheelchair access beforehand. This has to stop.

attributes.action: Revise the current council tax system which is not fit for purpose.
attributes.background: Currently properties are assigned a council tax band (A â€“ H) according to their market value in April 1991. Band A properties under Â£40k whilst Band H over Â£320k. Despite houses prices rising considerably and disproportionately in some areas, the banding system has remained unchanged for 27 years.
attributes.additional_details:
There are insufficient bands to reflect the current value of properties and charges.  In 2017 the council tax for Band H properties worth millions in Westminster and Kensington and Chelsea was Â£1376 and Â£2124 respectively, whilst in East Sussex it was Â£3500 for houses worth a fraction of the price.  The system is unfair and advantages those with high value properties

One solution is increase the number of bands to reflect the current variation in house values and make the system more equitable.

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring cattle allowed to graze grass outside min. 8 hours per day
attributes.background: Many dairy cattle are kept in sheds for up to 24 hours a day, in some cases all year. They're fed diets which aren't healthy or natural for them. As a result of this, over-milking and preventing movement they typically become ill and are killed at 3 to 5 years old. Their natural lifespan is 20 years
attributes.additional_details:
Scientific studies & other information
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17033013
https://stud.epsilon.slu.se/5285/1/kivling_s_130215.pdf
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235185/the-life-of-dairy-cows.pdf
http://www.research.ed.ac.uk/portal/en/publications/housing-system-milk-production-and-zerograzing-effects-on-lameness-and-leg-injury-in-dairy-cows(117d66b0-cd77-4c79-82f6-d15053cd02fb).html

attributes.action: Move the Palace of Westminster to new purpose-built Parliament in Birmingham
attributes.background: The existing Palace of Westminster is no longer 'fit for purpose'.  The adversarial debating chamber is archaic and the infrastructure needs total upgrading.  The proposed cost for refurbishment could be spent on a new building in Birmingham, the centre of Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
It's time Parliament dragged itself into the 21st century.  By relocating to Birmingham in the centre of Britain, government can truly represent all the people and not just the elite, privileged few.  
Estimated costs to refurbish the existing Palace of Westminster are unacceptable:
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/jan/28/mps-to-vote-on-vacating-parliament-building-in-need-of-refurbishment
A modern debating chamber is essential for fair government.

attributes.action: Impose an immediate ban on the use of Polystyrene in packaging.
attributes.background: Polystyrene is easily replaced with biodegradable alternatives. Polystyrene cannot be easily recycled and usually ends up in either landfill sites or the sea. Polystyrene breaks down easily to ever smaller partials which poison the food chain, and takes thousands of years to break down.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys from restaurant kids meals
attributes.background: As part of a concerted effort to reduce plastic consumption, we should tackle the easy target of removing the toys given as part of happy meals from restaurants such as McDonald's and Burger King. These toys could easily be replaced with something more educational and environmentally friendly.

attributes.action: Debate the relevance of the Right to Buy legislation
attributes.background: Because of the increasing number of homeless families/single people, this request asks that Parliament debates the relevancy of the Right to Buy legislation, considering whether by revoking it thereby leaving more homes under Council control the numbers of homeless might decrease.
attributes.additional_details: I recently saw a discussion on the television where the particular Council responding to a question concerning their inability to house homeless families/single people said that for every three properties they built, two others of their stock went for 'right to buy'. I know little of the problems of Councils housing people nor of the Right to Buy Legislation but it seems to me possible that those that introduced the legislation may not have anticipated todays number of homeless.

attributes.action: Pressure video sharing sites to remove violent/graphic videos targeted at kids
attributes.background: The online safety of our kids is not being taken seriously by video sharing sites like YouTube. There are hundreds maybe thousands of videos being masked as our children's favourite cartoons. More needs to be done to remove this content before it is published!

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for all new vehicles to be fitted with a tracking device
attributes.background: Car theft is rising in the UK with the vast majority being uninvestigsted by the police either though budget cuts or lack of evidence. This is why all new vehicles sold in the UK should be factory fitted with a tracking device. This will make car theft a thing of the past.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.easier.com/93725-stolen-cars-fitted-tracker-recovered.html

http://eb-iaati.org/news/entry/uk_chance_of_getting_your_stolen_car_back_drops_to_less_than_50_per_cent
